name: General Knowledge 2 Multiple Choice Quiz | Mixed 25 Questions

questions.text: Which of 'The Beatles' won a younger set of fans as the voice of 'Thomas the Tank Engine'?
Which is not one of the main five boroughs of New York City?
questions.explanation:
Ellis Island.

	Also Brooklyn and the Bronx.

questions.text: 'The Simpsons', a television cartoon series, is set in which location?
Which river forms the Victoria Falls?
questions.explanation:
Zambezi.

	It is one of the world's biggest waterfalls and its roar can be heard 40 kilometres away.

questions.text: Which European country gets its name from the Romans who occupied it almost 2,000 years ago?
The Niagara river flows between two Great Lakes. Erie to ....?
New York began in 1625 as the Dutch settlement of New Amsterdam. Which nationality renamed it New York when they took over in 1664?
Israel is famous for Jaffa oranges named after the place, Jaffa. Which present day Israeli city was united with Jaffa in 1950?
Where would you find the 'Nullarbor Plain'?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	It is found in Southern Australia and the name comes from the Latin 'Nulla Arbor' (no tree).

questions.text: Which of the following would not be found in a mosque?
questions.explanation:
Paintings or statues.

	A fountain is used for ceremonial washing, and a muezzin (crier) calls the faithful to prayer five times a day.

questions.text: Which of these group names means 'from the start' in Latin?
Which country has the world's largest fishing industry with 400,000 vessels catching 12 million tonnes of fish a year?
'Smorgasbord' is a Swedish specialty. 'Bord' means table, but what does 'smorgas' mean?
What was discovered in the Venezuelan lake 'Maracaibo' in 1917 which turned it from one of South America's poorest countries to one of the richest?
Complete the list: Aventine, Caelian, Esquiline, Palatine, Quirinal, Viminal and ... ?
questions.explanation:
Capitoline.

	The seven hills on which Rome was built.

questions.text: Where is the world's tallest cathedral spire at 160.9 metres tall?
Abel Magwitch appears in which Dicken's novel?
Liverpool is naming its airport in honour of murdered ex-Beatle John Lennon. What was the airport's former name?
What is the nationality of the author Roald Dahl?
questions.explanation:
Welsh.

	His parents were Norwegian but he was born in Llandaff, Glamorgan, Wales.

questions.text: In Alfred Hitchcock's 'Psycho', what was used as blood to terrify audiences in the famous shower scene?
questions.explanation:
Chocolate sauce.

	The film was made in 1960 in black and white so you were no wiser.

questions.text: The full name of the 'Statue of Liberty' is 'Liberty Enlightening the World'. How many spikes are there in the crown?
questions.explanation:
7.

	The seven spikes in the crown stand for Liberty's light shining on the world's seven seas and continents.

questions.text: How many famous colourful towers does St. Basil's Cathedral have in Moscow?
Which river is Africa's second longest river?
questions.explanation:
Congo.

	The Congo river is the world's eighth longest river. It is also known as the river Zaire.

questions.text: Venice has 177 canals. How many islands is the ancient city set on?
Which country's political capital city contains the word 'dodo'?
questions.explanation:
Tanzania & Dodoma.

	Although Dar es Salaam is the commercial capital of Tanzania, Dodoma is the political capital with the National Assembly relocating there in 1996. Hope you enjoyed the challenge.
